articles.title: Walmart cuts starting pay for some new hires - WSJ
articles.content: Walmart is paying some new store workers less than it would have three months ago, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday.

articles.title: Factbox-Key dates on Trump's overlapping legal and political calendars
articles.content: Former U.S. President Donald Trump faces a tangled calendar in the year ahead as he seeks the 2024 Republican nomination while trying to fend off four criminal and three civil trials, some related to his attempts to overturn his 2020 loss.

articles.title: Shunning global summits, Xi visits flood-stricken area in northeast China
articles.content: Eschewing face-time with foreign leaders at global summits this week, Chinese President Xi Jinping on Thursday visited the homes of villagers in a rural part of northeast China battered by floods.

articles.title: Russian businessman gets 9 years in US prison for hack-and-trade scheme
articles.content: A Russian businessman with ties to the Kremlin was sentenced on Thursday to nine years in a U.S. prison after being convicted of participating in a $93 million insider-trading scheme involving hacked secret earnings information about multiple companies.

articles.title: French teenager dies after collision with police car, government urges calm
articles.content: PARIS (Reuters) -The French government on Thursday called for calm following the death of a 16-year-old boy whose motorbike collided with a police car on a road outside Paris.

articles.title: Boeing will meet 737 delivery goal despite new production problem -CFO
articles.content: WASHINGTON xx (Reuters) -Boeing is set to meet targets to deliver at least 400 narrowbody 737s this year, its chief financial officer said on Thursday, despite a recently discovered production flaw that has slowed deliveries of its bestselling 737 MAX.

articles.title: Exclusive-Kurdish-led Syria force vows to meet tribal demands after clash
articles.content: The head of the U.S.-backed Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) pledged to meet Arab tribal demands in eastern Syria and fix "mistakes" he said had been made in administering the region, seeking to defuse tensions that fuelled days of deadly fighting.

articles.title: Ukraine reports Danube port damage after latest Russian attack
articles.content: KYIV (Reuters) -Russia carried out its fourth drone attack in five days on Ukrainian port facilities on the Danube River on Thursday, damaging grain silos and other infrastructure on a vital export route for Kyiv, Ukrainian officials said.

articles.title: Russians vote in tightly controlled regional elections
articles.content: Russians finish voting on Sunday in tightly controlled regional and local elections that are likely to be interpreted by authorities as a vote of confidence in President Vladimir Putin.

articles.title: Factbox-U.S IPO market poised for strong finish in 2023 amid a flurry of listings
articles.content: U.S. investors are awaiting a slew of initial public offerings (IPO) in coming months, hoping to ride the recent rally in equity markets.

message.content:
BRIEFING:

Category: Energy

Title: Europe's renewables push undermines Russian weaponization of energy: Kerry
Content: Europe is making itself stronger against Russian attempts to weaponize energy by switching to clean sources faster, U.S. Special Presidential Envoy for Climate John Kerry said on Thursday.

Background: Europe's dependence on Russian energy has been a concern for national security. By transitioning to renewable energy sources, Europe reduces its reliance on fossil fuels and weakens Russia's ability to manipulate energy markets for political gain.

Link: [Read more](reuters.com/article/climate-change-europe-kerry/europes-renewables-push-undermines-russian-weaponization-of-energy-kerry-idUSKBN30D1DW)

Category: Finance

Title: Industry bodies urge EU to ditch euro clearing relocation plan
Content: Leading users of derivatives markets in the European Union called on the bloc on Thursday to scrap a plan that would force them to shift euro derivatives clearing from London to the EU.

Background: The relocation of euro clearing from London to the EU is a consequence of Brexit and poses challenges to financial institutions. Critics argue that this move may fragment the market and increase costs.

Link: [Read more](reuters.com/article/eu-derivatives/industry-bodies-urge-eu-to-ditch-euro-clearing-relocation-plan-idUSKBN30D0LX)

Category: Technology

Title: Global regulators seek to crack down on decentralised finance
Content: Global securities regulators set out on Thursday their first blueprint to make participants in "decentralised finance" (DeFi) accountable for their actions and safeguard market stability.

Background: Decentralised finance, or DeFi, refers to blockchain-based financial applications that operate without the need for traditional intermediaries. The rapid growth of DeFi has raised concerns over potential risks and the need for regulatory oversight.

Link: [Read more](reuters.com/article/cryptocurrency-regulator/global-regulators-seek-to-crack-down-on-decentralised-finance-idUSKBN30D0WJ)

Category: Banking

Title: U.S. bank profits flat after accounting for failed bank acquisitions: FDIC
Content: U.S. bank profits were largely flat in the second quarter of 2023 after accounting for the impact of three large failed bank acquisitions, the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation reported Thursday.

Background: The consolidation of banks through acquisitions can have a significant impact on financial performance. Failed acquisitions can result in one-time costs and disruptions, affecting profit stability in the banking industry.

Link: [Read more](reuters.com/article/usa-fdic-results/u-s-bank-profits-flat-after-accounting-for-failed-bank-acquisitions-fdic-idUSKBN30D1AO)

Category: Aviation

Title: Boeing will meet 737 delivery goal despite new production problem -CFO
Content: Boeing is set to meet targets to deliver at least 400 narrowbody 737s this year, its chief financial officer said on Thursday, despite a recently discovered production flaw that has slowed deliveries of its bestselling 737 MAX.

Background: Boeing's 737 MAX aircraft has faced multiple issues in recent years, including two deadly crashes that led to its grounding. The production flaw mentioned in this article highlights ongoing challenges for Boeing's supply chain but does not impact delivery goals.

Link: [Read more](reuters.com/article/boeing-cfo/boeing-will-meet-737-delivery-goal-despite-new-production-problem-cfo-idUSKBN30D14O)

Category: Politics

Title: US and EU slam Palestinian president's remarks on Holocaust
Content: The United States and European Union on Thursday criticized remarks about the World War Two persecution of Jews and antisemitism by Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas.

Background: Holocaust denial and antisemitism are highly sensitive issues. The criticism by the US and the EU reflects the importance of acknowledging historical atrocities to promote understanding and prevent the perpetuation of hate speech.

Link: [Read more](reuters.com/article/israel-palestinians-abbas-holocaust/us-and-eu-slam-palestinian-presidents-remarks-on-holocaust-idUSKBN30D1CG)

Category: Politics

Title: Mexico president backs ruling party candidate after disputed selection process
Content: Mexico's president on Thursday vigorously backed his party's selection of former Mexico City Mayor Claudia Sheinbaum as its candidate to succeed him in 2024, dismissing the objections of her main rival that the contest was unfair.

Background: The selection of political candidates can be a contentious process. In this case, Mexico's president publicly supports his party's choice despite allegations of unfairness, highlighting the political dynamics surrounding succession planning.

Link: [Read more](reuters.com/article/mexico-politics/mexico-president-backs-ruling-party-candidate-after-disputed-selection-process-idUSKBN30D174)

Category: Politics

Title: Gabon junta names former PM Raymond Ndong Sima as interim PM - statement
Content: Gabon's military junta has named a former prime minister, Raymond Ndong Sima, as the country's new interim prime minister, it said in a statement broadcast on national television on Thursday.

Background: Political transitions, especially in countries with unstable governance, can be complex and involve military intervention. The military junta's appointment of an interim prime minister reflects the power dynamics at play during Gabon's political transition.

Link: [Read more](reuters.com/article/gabon-security-politics/gabon-junta-names-former-pm-raymond-ndong-sima-as-interim-pm-statement-idUSKBN30D1DG)

Category: Economy

Title: Mexican core inflation slows more than expected to 20-month low
Content: Annual core inflation in Mexico slowed to a 20-month low in August, data from statistics agency INEGI showed on Thursday, below market forecasts as the country's central bank holds interest rates to tamp down on price increases.

Background: Inflation is a critical economic indicator that affects purchasing power and financial stability. The Mexican central bank's decision to hold interest rates reflects efforts to manage inflationary pressures and stabilize the economy.

Link: [Read more](reuters.com/article/mexico-economy-inflation/mexican-core-inflation-slows-more-than-expected-to-20-month-low-idUSKBN30D13E)

Category: Politics

Title: Ukraine tycoon Kolomoisky is suspect in second criminal case - lawmaker
Content: Ukrainian anti-corruption authorities suspect tycoon Ihor Kolomoisky of involvement in the embezzlement of $250 million, a lawmaker said on Thursday, dealing a potentially major new blow to one of the country's richest men.

Background: The investigation into embezzlement allegations against a prominent tycoon sheds light on ongoing efforts to combat corruption in Ukraine. Such cases have implications for the country's economic and political landscape.

Link: [Read more](reuters.com/article/ukraine-crisis-kolomoisky/ukraine-tycoon-kolomoisky-is-suspect-in-second-criminal-case-lawmaker-idUSKBN30D13A)
